title: I need some input on this.
content:
It's a logo I plan to use in a coffee bar illustration. I haven't designed that yet.   
I guess I just wanted to mess with this first.   
   
   
I don't want to keep refining this if the concept has some fatal flaw I'm missing.   
   
Andrew   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106085600im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/38876.gif)
author: andrew_baker

comments.content:
I like the 'Percolators' part, I am not too sure about the 'The' part, if this makes any sense at all..   
_( 'The' just seems too straight, too 'normal', maybe, compared to the 'vintage', organic feel of 'Percolators'.. )_

It seems like you are cramming a literal coffee reference into the "the P" combination. It doesn't really seem necessary to have a kettle in this mark. Or if you want a kettle in the mark, don't hide it.

Hey guys,   
   
Thanks for the input. I'll come up with a variant.   
   
Andrew

Part of the "band" in the illustration.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106085600im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/38977.gif)
